intro: Coccothrinax latifrons, commonly known as the broad-leaved palm, is a species of flowering plant in the Arecaceae family. It is native to the Caribbean, particularly found in the Greater Antilles, including Cuba, Jamaica, and Hispaniola. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, fan-shaped leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and windy conditions. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it plays an important role in the ecological diversity of its native regions.
